EC2Errors.error_message: User: arn:aws:iam::123456789012:user/example is not authorized to perform: ec2:RunInstances because no identity-based policy allows the ec2:RunInstances action
remediation_steps: Check attached IAM policies using: `aws iam list-attached-user-policies --user-name example`
Add minimum required permissions: `ec2:RunInstances`, `ec2:Describe*`
Test permissions with IAM Policy Simulator
Verify no SCPs are blocking the action at the OU/account level

EC2Errors.error_message: The provided credentials do not have permission to create the service-linked role for EC2 Spot Instances
remediation_steps: Ensure IAM entity has: `iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole`
Pre-create the role: `aws iam create-service-linked-role --aws-service-name spot.amazonaws.com`
Check for explicit denies in permission boundaries
Verify cross-account role assumptions (if applicable)

EC2Errors.error_message: There is insufficient capacity for the requested instance type (m5.2xlarge) in the selected Availability Zone (us-east-1a)
remediation_steps: Retry in different AZ: `aws ec2 describe-availability-zones`
Request alternative instance types (e.g., m5.xlarge)
Use Capacity Reservations for critical workloads
Submit limit increase case via AWS Support

EC2Errors.error_message: The volume 'vol-123456' is already attached to an instance
remediation_steps: Identify attached instance: `aws ec2 describe-volumes --volume-ids vol-123456`
Gracefully detach: `aws ec2 detach-volume --volume-id vol-123456`
For terminated instances: `aws ec2 detach-volume --volume-id vol-123456 --force`
Wait for state=available before reattaching

EC2Errors.error_message: The subnet ID 'subnet-123456' does not exist in the specified Availability Zone
remediation_steps: List valid subnets: `aws ec2 describe-subnets --filters Name=vpc-id,Values=vpc-123456`
Verify cross-region/account access
Check CloudFormation/Terraform outputs for correct subnet mapping
Validate VPC peering connections if using shared subnets

EC2Errors.error_message: The maximum number of instances allowed for your AWS account (20) has been reached in the us-east-1 region
remediation_steps: Terminate unused instances: `aws ec2 terminate-instances --instance-ids i-123456`
Request limit increase via Service Quotas console
Use smaller instance types or consolidate workloads
Consider AWS Organizations for multi-account strategy

EC2Errors.error_message: The image ID 'ami-123456' does not exist in this region
remediation_steps: List available AMIs: `aws ec2 describe-images --owners self amazon`
Copy AMI to target region: `aws ec2 copy-image --source-region us-west-1 --source-image-id ami-123456`
Verify AMI sharing if using cross-account
Check AWS Marketplace subscription status

EC2Errors.error_message: The request was denied due to AWS API request throttling. Wait and retry your request
remediation_steps: Implement exponential backoff in your code
Reduce API call frequency using caching
Use describe* APIs with filters instead of multiple calls
Request increased API limits via AWS Support

EC2Errors.error_message: The instance 'i-123456' does not support the requested operation (e.g., EBS optimization)
remediation_steps: Check instance type capabilities: `aws ec2 describe-instance-types --instance-types m5.large`
Modify instance attributes: `aws ec2 modify-instance-attribute --instance-id i-123456 --ebs-optimized`
Stop/Change to supported instance type if required
Verify virtualization type (HVM vs PV)

EC2Errors.error_message: The volume 'vol-123456' cannot be detached while the instance is in the 'stopping' state
remediation_steps: Wait for instance to fully stop (check with `aws ec2 describe-instances`)
Force detach if urgent: `aws ec2 detach-volume --volume-id vol-123456 --force`
Reboot instance first if possible
Check for kernel-level disk activity before detaching

EC2Errors.error_message: The parameter 'SubnetId' cannot be used with the parameter 'NetworkInterfaces'
remediation_steps: Use either SubnetId OR NetworkInterfaces, not both
For advanced networking, specify all ENI details in NetworkInterfaces
Verify launch template/config consistency
Check for conflicting parameters in Auto Scaling Groups

EC2Errors.error_message: The security group ID 'sg-123456' does not exist in the default VPC
remediation_steps: List available SGs: `aws ec2 describe-security-groups`
Verify VPC ID: `aws ec2 describe-vpcs`
Check cross-region references
Recreate security group if deleted recently

EC2Errors.error_message: The maximum number of Elastic IP addresses has been reached for your AWS account in this region
remediation_steps: Release unused EIPs: `aws ec2 release-address --allocation-id eipalloc-123456`
Request quota increase via Service Quotas
Use NAT Gateway instead of instance-attached EIPs
Consider AWS PrivateLink for internal services

EC2Errors.error_message: The key pair 'my-keypair' does not exist in this region
remediation_steps: List available keys: `aws ec2 describe-key-pairs`
Import key to correct region: `aws ec2 import-key-pair --key-name my-keypair --public-key-material file://key.pub`
Verify key pair exists in correct AWS account
For Windows instances, check password retrieval method

EC2Errors.error_message: You have exceeded the maximum number of snapshots (5) that can be created simultaneously from a single volume
remediation_steps: Wait for existing snapshots to complete
Implement snapshot scheduling instead of bulk creation
Use AWS Backup for managed snapshot lifecycle
Request limit increase if business-critical

EC2Errors.error_message: The maximum number of Spot Instance requests (20) has been reached for your account in this region
remediation_steps: Cancel unused requests: `aws ec2 cancel-spot-instance-requests --spot-instance-request-ids sir-123456`
Use Spot Fleets to manage capacity pools
Request limit increase via AWS Support
Consolidate workloads using larger instance types

EC2Errors.error_message: The Spot Fleet request configuration is invalid: Invalid allocation strategy
remediation_steps: Validate allocation strategy: lowestPrice/diversified/capacityOptimized
Check IAM permissions for spot-fleet-request
Verify instance type/subnet combinations
Use AWS-provided sample configurations

EC2Errors.error_message: The instance password is not available yet. Please wait 5 minutes after launch
remediation_steps: Wait 5-10 minutes after instance launch
Verify EC2Connect agent is running (Windows)
Check system log for password generation status
Use AWS Session Manager for SSH/RDP alternative

EC2Errors.error_message: Failed to retrieve instance metadata from IMDSv2. Enable IMDSv2 in your launch template
remediation_steps: Modify instance metadata options: `aws ec2 modify-instance-metadata-options --instance-id i-123456 --http-tokens required`
Update launch templates to enforce IMDSv2
Test with: `curl -X PUT
-H
Check security group rules for metadata service access

EC2Errors.error_message: The instance attribute 'disableApiTermination' cannot be modified for instances in the 'terminated' state
remediation_steps: Check instance state: `aws ec2 describe-instances --instance-ids i-123456`
Modify attributes before termination
Use AWS Config to enforce termination protection
For terminated instances, relaunch with correct attributes
